fields.name: content
fields.description: acquire a piece of content given its URL. Uses the content platform's xref service.

args.name: path
args.description: The web URL of the content

args.name: id
args.description: The node ID of the content

args.name: ids
args.description: The ids of the menus to retrieve

fields.name: wikidata
fields.description: wikidata for schema.org

fields.name: canonical
fields.description:
Returns data in the canonical model.
workflow defaults to "pub" (published) but can be "del" (deleted/unpublished), etc.
body defaults to "html" but can be "json" or "text"
ref is a CP URL. Example: canonical(ref: "/xref/economist/trumpinterview")

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The content's node ID. Don't be fooled! it's not always a number!

fields.name: originalID
fields.description: The immutable originalID coming from the MT

fields.name: slug
fields.description: A non-unique machine-friendly identifier as a human-readable lowercase and dashes string

fields.name: type
fields.description: What kind of content it is (blog post? article?)

fields.name: superType
fields.description: Whether this is an article or a list

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this content

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The topic. Only appears in blogs.

fields.name: tpType
fields.description: Trust project - list of type of content

fields.name: tpAuthor
fields.description: Trust project - author

fields.name: citations
fields.description: Trust project - citations

fields.name: rubric
fields.description: The rubric of an article (short text displayed above the body)

fields.name: dateCreated
fields.description: When this piece of content was created

fields.name: dateModified
fields.description: When this piece of content was last changed

fields.name: datePublished
fields.description: When this piece of content was published.

fields.name: dateCreatedString
fields.description: Formatted string describing when this was created

fields.name: dateModifiedString
fields.description: Formatted string describing when this was last modified

fields.name: datePublishedString
fields.description: Date of publication, as a formatted string

fields.name: dateCreatedTimeAgo
fields.description: Formatted string describing when the post was published, in relative time. Example: "X hours ago", "yesterday"

fields.name: datePublishedTimeAgo
fields.description: Formatted string describing when the post was published, in relative time. Example: "X hours ago", "yesterday"

fields.name: author
fields.description: The post's author

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of a Blog. Only applies to Blogs.

fields.name: teaser
fields.description: A short excerpt of the text contents, in case of an article

fields.name: text
fields.description: The post in its entirety

fields.name: html
fields.description: The post parsed as an html tree

fields.name: configuration
fields.description: Configurations related to the exposed content

fields.name: webURL
fields.description: The canonical public URL of the piece of content

fields.name: mainImageObj
fields.description: Image used at the top of the article.

fields.name: mainImage
fields.description: Image used at the top of the article.

fields.name: promoImage
fields.description: Image used for list pages, social sharing, meta tags.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: The collection this content belongs to. Can be a blog in the case of a blog post, or a section in the case of an article

fields.name: parentCollection
fields.description: Reverse lookup for a storyCollection this content could belong to.

args.name: collectionID
args.description: The ID of the collection we want to check.

args.name: ids
args.description: The ids of the collections to reverse lookup

fields.name: print
fields.description: Print titles and flyTitles for an article

fields.name: issueInformation
fields.description: (print articles only) Information of the issue an article belongs to

fields.name: issueSiblings
fields.description: Children of this content type. May be the posts of a blog, or the items on the rows of the home page.

args.name: page
args.description: Paginate the children. Defaults to page 0, and doesn't apply to print editions.

args.name: to
args.description: What item to end in (exclusive). "-1" gets translated to "everything until the end", also known as "to=max"

fields.name: sectionSiblings
fields.description: siblings of an article in a section

args.name: page
args.description: Paginate the children. Defaults to page 0, and doesn't apply to print editions.

args.name: to
args.description: What item to end in (exclusive). "-1" gets translated to "everything until the end", also known as "to=max"

fields.name: commentCount
fields.description: The number of comments.

fields.name: commentStatus
fields.description: The current status of the comments.

fields.name: followPaywall
fields.description: Follow the paywall.

fields.name: printEdition
fields.description: (articles only) whether this came from a print edition

fields.name: printSectionName
fields.description: (articles only) the name of the print section this article came in, in case of a print edition article

fields.name: articleSection
fields.description: (articles only) the url of the article section

fields.name: dfp
fields.description: DoubleClick for Publishers site, zone and environment.

fields.name: newIssue
fields.description: A mapper link that returns the print edition details

fields.name: locationCreated
fields.description: (articles only) country where the article is from

fields.name: children
fields.description: Children of this content type. May be the posts of a blog, or the items on the rows of the home page.

args.name: page
args.description: Paginate the children. Defaults to page 0, and doesn't apply to print editions.

args.name: to
args.description: What item to end in (exclusive). "-1" gets translated to "everything until the end", also known as "to=max"

fields.name: grapeshot
fields.description: A list of automated tags from grapeshot

fields.name: topics
fields.description: A list of topics this content belongs to

fields.name: rss
fields.description: Public-facing URL of the RSS feed (if applicable)

fields.name: atom
fields.description: Public-facing URL of the Atom feed (if applicable)

fields.name: twitter
fields.description: Official twitter account (blogs only)

fields.name: internal
fields.description: Whether the element is internal or external of the website

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: Attributes
types.description: Attributes of the image object

fields.name: alt

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of image

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path of image

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of image

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: PrintHeadlines
types.description: Alternative print headlines for a print article

fields.name: description
fields.description: The print description of the article

fields.name: headline
fields.description: The print title for the article

fields.name: subHeadline
fields.description: The print flyTitle for the article

types.name: XRefPage
types.description: A page of arbitrary content elements. Contains the entries of this page, and informs whether it's the last page

fields.name: entries
fields.description: Entries in this page

fields.name: isLastPage
fields.description: Flag signaling this is the last page

fields.name: resultCount
fields.description: Total results available in list

fields.name: pageCount
fields.description: Total pages available in list

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: dfp
types.description:
Information for ads provided by DoubleClick For Publishers
  (https://jira.economist.com/wiki/display/EBR/Ads+endpoint+and+refactor)

fields.name: zone

fields.name: site
fields.description: The site of the ad

fields.name: environment
fields.description: The environment where the ad is published

fields.name: id
fields.description: The identifier of a menu

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of a menu

fields.name: links
fields.description: The list of links in a menu

types.description: A link object belonging to a menu

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of a link

fields.name: href
fields.description: The href of a link

fields.name: meta
fields.description: The meta of a link

fields.name: order
fields.description: The order index of a link

fields.name: internal
fields.description: Whether the link is internal (IE: if it opens in a new tab or not)

types.name: videos

fields.description: The latest videos from the Espresso App

types.description: A list of videos form the Espresso App

fields.description: The small image of the video

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Content
types.description: Canonical content type.

fields.name: about
fields.description: The subject matter of the content.

fields.name: accountablePerson
fields.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

fields.name: ad
fields.description: Advert related meta data.

fields.name: articleSection
fields.description: Articles may belong to one or more sections in a magazine or newspaper.

fields.name: associatedMedia
fields.description: List of other media objects associated, e.g. pdf.

fields.name: audience
fields.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

fields.name: audio
fields.description: Audio data associated to this content.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The authors of this content or the recorders of this media.

fields.name: autoStart
fields.description: Switch to automatically start this media.

fields.name: bitrate
fields.description: The bitrate of the media object.

fields.name: byline
fields.description: Accompanying line of text giving the author's name or credits for multimedia assets.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: Channel such as a website, blog, periodical or publication where this content was originally published, e.g. Espresso, economist.com, The Economist, 1843, etc.

fields.name: context
fields.description:
Reference to associated user generated content
TODO comment: hyperMediaRef
Context - provides contextual information around the
content in relation to other content i.e list position.

fields.name: contributor
fields.description: secondary contributors to the CreativeWork.

fields.name: copyrightHolder
fields.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

fields.name: copyrightYear
fields.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

fields.name: dateCreated
fields.description: The GMT date on which the content was created.

fields.name: dateExpired
fields.description: The GMT date on which the content will expire.

fields.name: dateModified
fields.description: The GMT date on which the content was last modified.

fields.name: datePublished
fields.description: The GMT date on which the content was published.

fields.name: dateline
fields.description: The location where the NewsArticle was produced.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Rubric, short description of the item, ALT attribute of image.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

fields.name: encodingFormat
fields.description: Encoding format of this Media: mp3, mpeg4, etc.

fields.name: genre
fields.description: IPTC Genre Codes

fields.name: hasPart
fields.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

fields.name: headline
fields.description: Head or Title of the content or ALT-text of an image, full name of an person, etc.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The height of the item in device pixels.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier hypermedia URL for this payload, based on the MT API Gateway if relative.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image data associated to this content

fields.name: inLanguage
fields.description: ISO 639 code of the language of the content or performance or used in an action.

fields.name: isAccessibleForFree
fields.description: A flag to signal  if the payload requires a subscription or is accessible for free. It is more generic than just 'requiresSubscription'.

fields.name: isPartOf
fields.description: Indicates a list of documents that are in some sense) a part of this document.

fields.name: jobTitle
fields.description: Job title (if this Content refers to a Person)

fields.name: keyword
fields.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keyword (singular form follows schema.org convention).

fields.name: license
fields.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

fields.name: locationCreated
fields.description: The locations where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork. Preferable as wikidata reference.

fields.name: mimetype
fields.description: The MIME type of the body.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Position - contextual position of content in a list.

fields.name: print
fields.description: Grouping all print specific data into one nested object.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: Publication such as a issue, edition or publication volume, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles. It replaces printEdition.

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The publisher of the content.

fields.name: regionsAllowed
fields.description: The ISO 3166 region codes where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere.

fields.name: rendition
fields.description: Different formats and renditions of this media, e.g. different video, audio or image formats and qualities.

fields.name: sameAs
fields.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity, e.g. cross reference of proprietary taxonomy term to public ressource.

fields.name: sourceOrganization
fields.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working, The photo agency on whose behalf the photographer was working.

fields.name: sponsor
fields.description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

fields.name: subheadline
fields.description: Sub-headline or flytitle of this document.

fields.name: tagline
fields.description: A byline at the end of a story.

fields.name: tegID
fields.description: The Economist Group canonical unique identifier for this document. Using Base32-Hex (RFC).

fields.name: tegType
fields.description: Economist Group internal content type.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Set of Schema.org content types.

fields.name: text
fields.description: The MIME type encoded text of the body.

fields.name: twitter
fields.description: Twitter handle (if this Content refers to a Person)

fields.name: url
fields.description: URLs associated with the content.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Semantic version of the payload worker.

fields.name: video
fields.description: Video data associated to this content.

fields.name: width
fields.description: The width of the item in device pixels.

fields.name: workflow
fields.description: Publication status of this piece of content during editorial workflow.

fields.name: internal
fields.description: List of internal/proprietary concepts.

fields.name: public
fields.description: List of public concepts, e.g. based on IPTC or Wikidata.

types.name: GrapeshotChannel
types.description: A grapeshot channel

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: byline
fields.description: Print specific accompanying line of text giving the author's name or credits for multimedia assets.

fields.name: column
fields.description: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

fields.name: description
fields.description: print specific rubric, short description

fields.name: headline
fields.description: print specific head or Title of the content or ALT-text of an image, full name of an person, etc.

fields.name: page
fields.description: this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

fields.name: pageEnd
fields.description: this field indicates the page number on which the article ends  on the print edition.

fields.name: pageStart
fields.description: this field indicates the page number on which the article starts on the print edition.

fields.name: section
fields.description: print section

fields.name: subheadline
fields.description: print specific sub-headline or flytitle of this document.

fields.name: tagline
fields.description: A print specific byline at the end of a story.

types.name: StringOrJson
types.description: Mixed type with string or JSON representation

fields.name: alias
fields.description: List of URLs the article can be or could be found but isn't the primary URL

fields.name: canonical
fields.description: The primary URL of this creative work

fields.name: short
fields.description: Default short URL

types.name: ReverseLookup
types.description: response object for the "lookup" query

fields.name: id
fields.description: The source ID of the content.

fields.name: idType
fields.description: The source type i.e. "node".

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source itself i.e. "economist".

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
